etymology.description: phonetic: 化 + semantic: 十 (“stalk and leaves”). Traditional 華 was originally a pictogram of a flowering plant, later also analyzed as phono-semantic with 于 (phonetic) + 艸 (semantic).
etymology.interpretation: In the simplified form, 化 supplies the sound huá, while 十 preserves a vestige of the plant imagery inherited from 華. The traditional form depicted a flower on a stalk and later gained a phonetic 于 with the plant marker 艸, linking the senses of ‘splendid/flowery’ and ‘Chinese.’
etymology.simplification: Top floral component of 華 was replaced by the phonetic 化 to reduce strokes and emphasize pronunciation; 华 was introduced in the 1956 PRC simplification and had no prior attested form.

examples.chinese: 我为中华文化自豪(我為中華文化自豪)。
examples.english: I am proud of Chinese culture.

examples.chinese: 他写了一篇华丽的文章(他寫了一篇華麗的文章)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiěle yì piān huálì de wénzhāng.

examples.chinese: 许多外企在华投资(許多外企在華投資)。
examples.english: Many foreign companies invest in China.
